attributes.action: New EU referendum should Scotland leave the UK and break the Union.
attributes.background: This petition calls for a suspension of any action for an exit from the EU until the issue of Scottish independance is resolved. If Scotland leave and the UK breaks up then a new question would need to be posed, reflecting the nature of the change, the original question becoming invalid.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition aims for Parliament to consider and plan through any serious changes that may result from Scottish independance and the impact this would have on the recent referendum result and mindset of the voting public.

The original referendum question posed was for the United Kingdom exiting the EU, should Scotland gain independance then the UK breaks up and the question is void, given the change of circumstances.

attributes.action: Allow the City and Greater London to join the EU
attributes.background: Given the EU referendum result showed a large discrepancy of opinion between those voting in London and those voting in England and Wales, we would like to initiate proceedings for the City and Greater London to join the EU.

attributes.action: Use Mixed-Member Proportional Representation to Elect the House of Commons
attributes.background:
Despite the most important question in an election being which party gets into power, you cannot vote directly for the party you favour. In many electorates, where the seat is safe, your vote doesn't matter at all.

MMP will give everyone a fairer say in government.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mixed-member_proportional_representation

http://www.voterpower.org.uk/

attributes.action: A new referendum: Leave the EU now or in 2036 (subject to a further referendum)?
attributes.background: We have voted to leave the EU which is irreversible. We now need a referendum to ascertain whether we leave the EU now or in 20 years' time (subject to a further referendum, of course)?
attributes.additional_details: The EU is not perfect and will probably be subject to some kind of reform in the coming decades. This additional referendum is to find out if the UK population would like postpone our exit pending any changes that may occur within the union.

attributes.action: Provide a way to account for children's opinion on issues affecting their future
attributes.background: 14 million under 18s live in the UK and aren't able to vote. According to Unicef they have the right for their views to be heard and respected. When important debates are taking place, directly affecting their future, we propose that their opinions should be officially collated by Government.
attributes.additional_details:
.UN Convention on the Rights of the Child, Article 12 (respect for the views of the child) and Article 13 (freedom of expression).
.Improving the Spiritual, Moral, Social and Cultural (SMSC) development of pupils: Departmental advice for independent schools, academies and free schools (DfE November 2013, p5)
.Section 78 of the Education Act 2002
.UNICEF- Promoting Children's Participation in Democratic Decision Making (Gerison Lansdown, UNICEF Innocenti Research Centre, ISBN: 88-85401-73-2)

attributes.action: No more cuts for working age people. Remove ringfencing of pensioner benefits
attributes.background: Since the financial crisis and recession it's young and working age people who have born the brunt of budget cutbacks. Real wages have fallen 7% for working families and 16% for 18-24 year olds. Pensioners have seen a 4% increase in the incomes which is neither fair or sustainable going forward.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst efforts to raise living standards in the elderly population is commendable, the disparity is now too great and ringfencing of pensioner benefits should be removed. This has become even more pressing in light out the EU referendum where the over 65 group voted strongly in favour of leaving the EU. Any negative economic effects of this decision should be shared across all who voted for it.

Figures quoted from Machin 2015

attributes.action: EU Referendum Rules to be made into Law that the first result stands.
attributes.background: To ensure fairplay in all referendums, the first and only vote is the one that must stand as the result. As a democratic society, any vote with a majority cannot be challenged just because some of the electorate are not happy at the result. There must be no TMO in this situation.
attributes.additional_details:
The EU referndum has been held and a majority of over 1 million voters chose the Leave option. A hardline minority of Remain campaingers have baulked at the result and are now tring to manipulate a democratic voting system by calling for a percentage ruling change. 

There is no actual evidence presented by parliament to support either option in the referendum as to the benefits or negatives of being a member of the EU. 

Any government leader that chose the remain option should now stand down.

attributes.action: Give greater autonomy to Northern England and create a Northern Assembly
attributes.background: The North of England is a diverse and great place and deserves to have the same say about its own laws and futures as places such as Wales and Scotland.

attributes.action: Form an emergency government made of leaders of each major political party
attributes.background:
This emergency government will be responsible for negotiating the exit from the EU.
Nominated leaders from each major political party will join together to negotiate so that every member of the public will be represented, and not just those who voted for a particular individual party.

attributes.action: Make Bristol an independent city state to rejoin the European Union.
attributes.background: The majority of Bristol voted to remain in the EU.  Lets make our vote count!

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Greater London becoming an independent, EU member state
attributes.background: We want a referendum held in Greater London on becoming an independent, federal state, that will remain a member of the European Union. This reflects the wishes of the majority of Londoners to remain in the EU
attributes.additional_details: The referendum on the 23rd of June clearly showed a divide in the beliefs of Londoners and the majority of the rest of England. Continued membership of the EU is vital if London is to remain the biggest financial centre in Europe. In addition, leaving would clearly go against the wishes of the majority of Londoners. We also believe that a divorce from the UK would be less traumatic than a split from the 450 million strong EU population

attributes.action: People over the age of 70 should not be allowed to vote
attributes.background: With the latest Brexit it is clear to see this was due to the votes of the older generation and not the younger one. However it is young people's future and they can't vote. If there is a limit on young age, why not old age?

attributes.action: Make June 22nd a national holiday, in tribute to Jo Cox. Cox's Day
attributes.background: Request an annual holiday as a reminder of Jo Cox and inspirational work and influence on peace and human rights. Hate will never win #moreincommon

attributes.action: Change the law on Historic Sexual abuse and assault cases and penalties
attributes.background: If a historic sexual abuse/assault case is brought before a court, if the case occurred earlier than 2003 a person prosecuted of the crime has a penalty or prison sentence which refers to the law under that point in time. All historic cases should use the current sentencing for historic cases also
attributes.additional_details: The current cases means that someone who abused someone in 1970's or 1980's only allows a person to be prosecuted under the laws of that time undermining the sentencing of someone who may have committed abhorent crimes against people, this would allow a better and more efficient way to proscute historical sexual crimes.

attributes.action: All licenced bars and clubs should have a breathalyser to prevent drink driving
attributes.background: This petition is to ask the government to make all licenced bars and clubs which serve alcohol to have breathalysers at hand for patrons to use if in control of a vehicle. This would minimise the risks associated with driving over the drink drive limit and would inturn reduce drink drive fatalities.

attributes.action: Abolish old & outdated leasehold law for all leasehold flats. Make them freehold
attributes.background: Crooked & unregulated freeholders hold leaseholders to ransom with high fees. When we buy a flat, we should also own a section of the outside part of the building and parts of the communal area. Responsibility should lie with the flat owner, not the freeholder. Commonhold law may be required here.
attributes.additional_details: The freeholder of the building should be forced to sell part of their freehold (for a cheap price) at the start and then eventually force them to give up the freehold. Leaseholders in UK are being conned and ripped off by unregulated freeholders.

attributes.action: Ban pheasant shooting - a cruel, senseless 'sport'.
attributes.background: Living in the countryside, we sadly witness repeated pheasant shoots taking place right before our eyes. Despite what they say, the pheasants more often than not die in a slow, painful manner often landing in our garden whilst still alive, in agony, dying slowly.This so-called 'sport' needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Repeated pheasant shoots take place across the UK, but I am speaking from personal experience of it happening in North Lincolnshire, more often than not without any prior notice given.

The pheasants are bred, released into the surrounding area, then shot repeatedly by people who enjoy killing animals for fun.

The pheasants are often mauled while still alive by dogs and/or write in agony as they land on the ground.

This is inhumane and needs to be stopped as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to deny estranged parents to be denied access to kids
attributes.background: It should be law that the estranged partner, be automatically allowed access to their children. If they truly pose a risk to them, the onus should be with the partner the children reside with to go to court prove why they feel it is not in the children's best interest to see the other parent.
attributes.additional_details: This mainly affects estranged Fathers, and now there is no legal aide for family matters, and the fact CSA take up to 40% of their wage for maintainence that they have to pay despite them being denied any kind of relationship with their children, a lot of Fathers can't afford to go to court. This is not equality!! If the children are young they can't express their needs, the law needs to ensure they do not suffer. We have enough childhood Depression. We need to put the children first.

attributes.action: Give grandparents the same funding as foster parents whether they work or not
attributes.background: Payment for grandparents who have grandchildren fulltime.
attributes.additional_details: Me and my husband work but can only get child benefit for 2 grandchildren who live with us fulltime so if they need clothes or shoes or anything else and it is more than £34 we have to pay for it. I think there should be some sort of payment like foster parents get because grandparents are doing the same job.

attributes.action: Parliamentary Election To Take Place 3 Months After Brexit.
attributes.background: Brexit has had huge impact not only on the economy, but has been divisive to the nation/s... for many people both brexiteers and remainers many have lost a lot of faith in the government ability and do not feel the government can take us forward to unite us and recover the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since Brexit, the countries division has been deep routed... And many people feel like their voices are not being heard. The government has been acting unilaterally ignoring a significant number of the population.

This has left very little confidence in the government's ability to fairly treat it's citizens. 

And the only way our voices will be heard is by holding a general election, to lead us in a positive direction and change.

attributes.action: Allow HMRC to provide tax exemptions where clerical errors have occurred
attributes.background: I dissolved a company rather than wound it up, and therefore HMRC is applying income tax rather than capital gains tax on the distributions. This was a clerical error, but there is no way to wind back the clock on such errors. HMRC should have the power to apply exemptions under such circumstances.

attributes.action: To have a legal maximum temperature in the work place.  A maximum of 25 degrees.
attributes.background: Working for long periods of time in constant heat above 30 degrees can lead to health problems  including headaches, vomiting, lung problems, dry skin.  Having a maximum temperature will result in happier staff and staff not needing yo take as many sick days.
attributes.additional_details: Hopefully it can be included in the health and safety at work act.

attributes.action: treat addiction as a mental health problem rather than criminal justice problem
attributes.background: The war on drugs has been a war fought with misinformation. We should not punish addicts but treat their addiction and what they choose to escape from when under the influence of substance abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Chasing the scream by Johann Hari

attributes.action: Allow "hoverboards" to be used on pavements
attributes.background: Currently hoverboards are not allowed on the public pavements. Many countries such as the USA and other EU countries are allowing it and they are after all a useful mode of transport. Unfortunately an out of date highways act says that we can't and it's high tide this is changed.

attributes.action: Placejob seekers on work programs within 6weeks of oringially signing on
attributes.background: To change the official help and courses job seekers receive down to 6 weeks of being unemployed rather than 6 months - the government needs to recognise that just because that a person has only just signed on, they may have been out of work a lot longer.

attributes.action: Introducing a theory test with Motorcycle Compulsory basic training
attributes.background: Motorcycles are an increasing form of transport, from delivery, commuting to pleasure. New motorcycle riders with no experience can legally ride without adequate training. Learner Motorcycle riders do not need to pass a theory test, producing inconsiderate, dangerous riders with poor road safety.
attributes.additional_details:
Current legislation states that a rider, whether young, old and of all level of experiences can learn to ride a motorcycle on the roads by simply completing a Compulsory basic training course. 
This consists of a manoeuvring and bike control session, then a road competence ride which is supervised.
During the CBT an instructor will assess your knowledge of the Highway code. This is not enough, too many riders put themselves at risk by not fully understanding the rules of the road.

attributes.action: Enable Greater Flexible Working For Parents.
attributes.background: The cost of childcare is not the only barrier influencing parents returning to work (that's another story). Many parents find it incredibly difficult to get a job due to the rigidity of working hours. We shouldn't have to choose between going to work or being a parent. Let's change that!
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can only apply for flexible working arrangements when you have been in employment for 26 weeks. Many job seeking parents cannot work prescribed hours and care for a family, and so they are excluded from the job market. 
Rigid working hours exclude many parents from contributing to society and contributing to their family income.
Enable employers to offer greater flexibility with working hours for parents from the start. Enable flexible start and finish times, not prescribed hours.

attributes.action: Ensure that Boxing Day is held specifically on 26th December. Day after Xmas day
attributes.background: If 26 Dec is on a Sun, Boxing Day in the UK is moved to 27 Dec. In the UK, Boxing Day is a bank holiday. If Boxing Day is on a Sat, the following Mon is a substitute bank holiday. On occasion when Xmas Day is on a Sat, the following Mon is Boxing Day and Tue a substitute bank holiday for Xmas.
attributes.additional_details:
The intention is to fix Boxing Day to the 26th Dec regardless of what day it falls on so that it is observed formally as a national holiday.

This would mean that if Boxing Day falls on a Saturday or a Sunday, that day is observed as Boxing Day and (Sunday) the Day of Rest is observed on the Monday instead.

This Petition is about recognising the priorities and people and how times have changed. Boxing Day would be given priority over business and Sunday day of rest.

attributes.action: Stop Private Railway Operators from wheel clamping under Railway Byelaw14
attributes.background: Vehicle clamping by private companies was deemed illegal in England and Wales in October 2012. However, Private Railway Operators can still legally exploit an old Railway Byelaw(14) which allows them to continue an aggressive campaign against railway passengers parking in their car parks.
attributes.additional_details:
They enlist private Contractors to handle this duty, and as a result, are generating thousands of pounds in revenue from excessive use of wheel clamping and by applying disproportionate penalties and release costs, for aggressive commercial gain.

Its time this ended, so please sign this petition if you believe the Department of Transport should take action, to ensure Railway Operators and their private clamping Contractors have to abide by the same Laws as anywhere else in the Country.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to fill out military medical forms within 48 hours.
attributes.background: Military applicants rely on their doctor to fill out a medical form involving medical history of the applicant. However doctors tend to sit on this paperwork for weeks, delaying the applicants entry process (which is very frustrating).
attributes.additional_details: Doctors get payed by the army, navy, airforce to fill these forms out and still sit on them for weeks even though many forms come with an urgent warning.

attributes.action: Referendum on replacing the House of Lords with a fully elected upper house
attributes.background: The current House of Lords does not reflect the UK population and is currently non elected, this means they has the power to block legislation that could be beneficial for the UK, without actually being elected by any British citizens. Hold a referendum to see if Britons want an elected upper house
attributes.additional_details: The UK is one of the only countries that includes non-elected religious leaders in its Upper House, the only other modern day country that has this is Iran.

attributes.action: Limit the amount in which uk councils can charge on council tax
attributes.background: Limit the amount councils can charge for council tax as recent years its getting out of control and hitting people hard.Councils also say they have to make cuts yet councils over spend on silly projects and waste money on useless departments. Better surport is needed to be given to those who strugle
attributes.additional_details:
Burton on trent east staffs wasted 30.000 on a plastic ice rink that they made a loss on and sold off for a loss. 

Amber valley wastes money on staff who are unhelpfull and heartless. 

Councils need to offer better surport to those who fall in to bad times not threaten them and make the situation harder.

attributes.action: Get Britain to join the North Atlantic Free Trade Area
attributes.background: Britain has left the undemocratic and overbearing EU but we still need to trade with the rest of the world.  So lets join NAFTA and not have to worry about a NAFTA parliament or "ever closer integration".

attributes.action: Introduce a living will the right to die if diagnose of Alzheimer or dementia
attributes.background:
I am 75 years of age and  I am in good health and sound of mind. I don't want to end my days where I don't know family and friends and I can't do anything for myself ie speak, wash, walk or feed myself. So
 I therefore want the right to die when two doctors say that I have no quality of life
attributes.additional_details:
I have friends and relatives that have either Alzheimer's or dementia. They don't know anybody, they can't feed themselves or wash or go the toilet and some can't even speak.They are just waiting to die, some of them have been like this for more than two years. In the early stages I was told by some of them that they wanted this option and die with dignity
there is no cure for these illnesses

attributes.action: Equality and fairness : Child Benefit system
attributes.background: Separated parents (with parental responsibility) that have shared custody of their children should be allowed to have an equal share in the benefits received for the children; the current system only allows one person to claim for child benefit.

attributes.action: Carbon emissions tax
attributes.background: For all UK tax payers to pay a tax of £7.50 each month of the year. Which then all money goes towards renewable energy and eventually lowers payroll tax.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone pollutes therefore everyone has a responsibility to on saving are great nation and doing our bit for the world. With the £7.50 month tax this means there will be an extra £195 Million pounds to renewable energy and research and development and in a year an extra £2.3 Billion pounds towards it!

attributes.action: make the dartford tunnel/crossing free when traffic jams are a mile back.
attributes.background:
To make the dartford tunnel/crossing free when tailback/traffic jams are a mile back.
We shouldn't have to pay for something that should've been free years ago.
The highways agency and sanef should sort this out.
Doing away with the barriers has made traffic tailbacks worse!

attributes.action: Increase the Teacher Training Bursuries for Core subjects and Primary Education.
attributes.background: The teacher training bursury for Biology has been slashed by £5000 since last year and is unacceptable. Biology is a core subject and should be treated with the same respect as Chemistry and Physics. To take away from the bursury will only push teachers to leave and teach abroad.
attributes.additional_details: The teacher training bursury is given to students hoping to become either primary or secondary school teachers, it is used to help pay their course fees of £9000 and their living expenses for the year as they do not recieve pay even though they will be working full time. Subjects that require specialism recieve a larger bursury. Biology is not an easy subject and is a core subject throughout young people's time In education and should be given the same bursury as chemistry and physics.

attributes.action: Fathers should not pay CSA if they don´t have access to their child
attributes.background: Mothers who claim CSA and do not let fathers see their child shouldn't be allowed to do so. A parent can´t have the best of both worlds claiming CSA and deny the other parent access, its not fair and its not right.
attributes.additional_details: I understand some cases are different i.e the other parent is dangerous for the child to stay with. In these cases CSA should still be available.

attributes.action: Increase digital government funding and introduce online voting
attributes.background:
- Increase funding of GovUK development
- Introduce citizens' and residents' online certificates for online voting and online conclusion of contracts
attributes.additional_details:
Gov.uk website is a robust but limited online application which is created to simplify life for interacting with government. This petition is aiming to state the importance to increase funding of more rapid development of digital services of the government.
Other ideas to discuss:
- Introduce digital citizenship (see Estonia)
- Introduce emails for all citizens where all communication lands
This may help to make UK more competitive.

attributes.action: Make the mechanics behind weight gain and loss compulsory for secondary schools
attributes.background: 64% of the UK population is overweight/obese. Many simply don’t understand why they are obese, and thus do not have the first idea of how to combat it. Basic information such as calculating Total Daily Energy Expenditure (TDEE) should be taught in secondary schools.
attributes.additional_details:
The average British person’s total daily energy expenditure is 2000 calories. Eating just 100 calories over this per day will lead to an average weight gain of nearly 10.5 pounds (4.7kg) a year. 100 calories is one large apple, half a plain bagel, or a packet of crisps.

Being overweight or obese is connected to many health problems, such as high blood pressure, diabetes, sleep apnoea and some cancers, as well as significantly reducing life expectancy and quality of life.

attributes.action: Make education of communism and its policies mandatory in all education
attributes.background: People need to be aware of the potential of a better life

attributes.action: Reduce the drink drive limit in England and Wales to the same level as Scotland
attributes.background: In 2014 an estimated 240 people were killed in Great Britain in accidents where at least one driver was over the legal limit. Drinking and driving increases the risk of a crash and the likelihood that death or serious injury will occur. Reducing the limit will save lives and make our roads safer.
attributes.additional_details: In December 2014 the Scottish Executive introduced The Road Traffic Act 1988 (Prescribed Limit) (Scotland) Regulations 2014 which reduced the legal alcohol limit for drivers to 50 milligrams of alcohol in every 100 millilitres of blood. The limit in England and Wales is 80 milligrams of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood. Bringing the limit in England and Wales in line with the limit in Scotland would be very beneficial as it would reduce accidents, preventing serious injury and death.

attributes.action: UK government to  strongly criticise the human rights violations in Balochistan.
attributes.background: There has been persecution of religious minorities, targeted killings of civilians, ethnic cleansing of shia muslims, hindus, punjabis, zikris and other minorities by frontier corps and inter service intelligence agency.
attributes.additional_details: This has been brought up by the US government as well as by Declan Welsh in the Guardian. Also Marc Tarabella and Brad Adams (exec. Director of Asian arm of Human Rights Watch) have condemned pakistani government of human rights abuses in balochistan and Azad kashmir. These people deserve to live a free life in their own countries rather than flee seeking justice elsewhere. The UK government needs to show its support to humanitarian causes and rights in every corner of the world.

attributes.action: Increase British military support in protecting endangered animals in Africa.
attributes.background: Hundreds of thousands of endangered animals in Africa are being poached every year throughout the continent. Many of the countries where this poaching is most common are very limited on resources that is needed to protect these animals. The British military would have the resources to make a impact.

attributes.action: To create an intermediate tier paper for maths GCSE (all exam boards)
attributes.background: Many students taking the higher tier maths GCSE paper, struggle with the contents, but find the foundation tier too easy. I am petitioning for an 'inbetween paper' that allows students of 'medium ability' to be able to get higher than a grade C at GCSE.

attributes.action: Restrict the ability to freely purchase sperm on Internet websites and now apps
attributes.background: It is grossly unacceptable to completely disregard a mans ability and purpose to father children. Women have the ability to freely browse Internet websites and now mobile apps for sprem based on specific requirements of donors eg height, IQ, race "without a medical reason". It's morally wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
I don't want to promote the websites and/or apps but it's free to download and sperm can be bought for the price of £950 at the click of a button without a medical reason.
If this catches on it could be a huge problem that would leave men unable to naturally father children and I find this seriously disturbing.

attributes.action: Request aid from United Nations World Food Programme in reducing malnutrition
attributes.background: Documented cases of child malnutrition are increasing in deprived areas in the UK. Local authorities do not have the resources to cope, and central government funding strategies are exacerbating the situation. Outside help appears to be the only available option.

attributes.action: Make swimming lessons avaliable in all schools
attributes.background: My daughter recently started school I was shocked to find that the school has no Intention to add swimming lessons to its classes surely it's in childrens best interests to ensure they can swim after all how many children drown due to the fact they can't swim
attributes.additional_details: About one in five people who die from drowning are children 14 and. Under

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory one month driving ban, for mobile phone use whilst driving
attributes.background: The Governments latest proposals, to crack down on mobile phone use whilst driving simply do not go far enough in my honest opinion and I say this not as someone whose life has been affected by this issue, rather that I hope that my friends or myself never will be !
attributes.additional_details:
From the window of my home I have an ideal vantage point to observe traffic as it comes to a halt at a nearby junction and, from the amount of people that I observe using their mobile phones, whilst they are driving it's very clear that the message is simply not getting across !

The introduction of a mandatory one month driving ban, for a first offence in addition to the proposed penalties would in my opinion be a more effective deterrent than what is currently on the table !
